bug_description:
Bug Description:

Bug ID: #101 
Project: JacksonDatabind 
Bug Type: Software Failure (SF)

1. Issue: 
In the 'deserializeUsingPropertyBasedWithUnwrapped' method, an issue arises when the parser attempts to parse the next token after copying the current structure of the token to the buffer. This results in a 'junit.framework.AssertionFailedError: expected not same' error message, indicating that the object expected by the assertion command is not the same as the actual object.

2. Faulty Statement:
The faulty behavior occurs at the code segment:

        p.nextToken();

The function call here leads to an incorrect token being produced in the parsing process.

3. Expected Versus Actual Result: 
The issue here reveals a discrepancy between the expected and actual program behavior. The test case fails as the objects that are being compared are not the same. 

4. Proposed Solution: 
The code rectification is done by adding a sanity check to verify that the expected condition is met before moving to the next token:

        if (t != JsonToken.END_OBJECT) {
            ctxt.reportWrongTokenException(this, JsonToken.END_OBJECT, 
                    "Attempted to unwrap '%s' value",
                    handledType().getName());
        }

This added sanity check reports an exception if the token is not of "END_OBJECT" type, making it easier to debug and trace the cause of the error.

5. Fixed Segment:
Following the changes made to resolve the bug, the fixed segment of the code is:

        p.nextToken();

The next token is parsed only when it is of the "END_OBJECT" JSON token type, avoiding the possible error of attempting to parse the incorrect token type. 

This detailed description of the bug should serve as a guide for developers to identify and rectify related bugs in java code.
